paper_abstract: For a given polynomial F(t) = Sigma(n)(i=0) p(i)B(i)(n)(t), expressed in the Bernstein basis over an interval [a, b], we prove that the number of real roots of F(t) in [a, b], counting multiplicities, does not exceed the sum of the number of real roots in [a, b] of the polynomial G(t) = Sigma(l)(i=k) p(i)B(i-k)(l-k) (counting multiplicities) with the number of sign changes in the two sequences (p(0),..., p(k)) and (p(l),..., p(n)) for any value k, l with 0 <= k <= l <= n. As a by product of this result, we give new refinements of the classical variation diminishing property of Bezier curves. (C) 2009 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: A refinement of the variation diminishing property of Bezier curves
